page.title: 15BRIGHTWELL HALL FARM.
page.content: {Brightwell Hall farm} in the Parish of Brightwell extends over 700 acres. In 1985 378 acres were used for growing cereal crops and 122 acres for root crops. Eleven people including the farm manager are employed by the owner. A typical working day starts at 7.30am and ends at 4.30pm Monday to Friday with some work at the weekends at busy times and for feeding the stock. Farm equipment includes 1 combine harvester,1 beet harvester and 8 tractors. The stock reared at the farm includes 250 lambs and 150 pedigree ewes.They also have 36 milking cows and 30 Herefords that are sucklers for the calves but are not milked. The soil tends to be light and sandy and some heavier soil which is mainly meadowland for cows is found in the valley of the Mill river, a small tributary of the Deben that runs through the farm.
